javadoc: VariableOffset can be used as an operand or sub-operand representation object. The toString() method should be used to obtain the displayable representation string. This object is intended to correspond to a explicit or implicit register/stack variable reference. If an offset other than 0 is specified, the original Scalar should be specified.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructor for an implied variable reference.

params.name: indirect
params.comment:
if true and variable data-type is a pointer, the offset 
 is relative to underlying data-type of the pointer-type.  This should generally be
 true for register use which would contain a structure pointer not a structure instance,
 whereas it would be false for stack-references.

params.name: dataAccess
params.comment: true if content of variable is being read and/or written

methods.javadoc:
Constructor for an explicit variable reference.
@param vref
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructor for an explicit variable reference.

methods.name: setReplacedElement
methods.comment: Sets the original replaced sub-operand Scalar.

params.name: includeScalarAdjustment
params.comment:
if true scalar adjustment will be included 
 with object list or string representation

methods.javadoc: Sets the original replaced sub-operand Register.
methods.name: setReplacedElement
methods.comment: Sets the original replaced sub-operand Register.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the Scalar or Register sub-operand replaced by this VariableOffset object.
@return object or null
methods.name: getReplacedElement
methods.comment: Returns the Scalar or Register sub-operand replaced by this VariableOffset object.

methods.javadoc:
Get list of markup objects
@return list of markup objects
methods.name: getObjects

name: VariableOffset
comment:
VariableOffset can be used as an operand or sub-operand representation
 object.  The toString() method should be used to obtain the displayable representation
 string.  This object is intended to correspond to a explicit or implicit register/stack 
 variable reference.  If an offset other than 0 is specified, the original Scalar should
 be specified.
